sentences.sContent: He downed his whisky in one swallow.
...I remember my aunt Mary used to say if you swallow a cherrystone...
...if I swallow one by mistake…W: Yeah...
...but there is immediate relief as you swallow information like mad...

remMethod.val: sw ＋ allow(承认) → 轻易承认 → 轻信

trans.tranOther: a small black and white bird that comes to northern countries in the summer

trans.tranCn: 吞， 咽； 轻信， 轻易接受； 承受， 使不流露； 咽下口水
trans.tranOther: to make food or drink go down your throat and towards your stomach
